definition: school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

sentences.english: For the new air route opened up and religious reform provided the necessary conditions.
sentences.chinese: 为新航路的开辟和宗教改革提供了必要的条件。

sentences.english: The Christian governance of marriage fractured during the Protestant Reformation.
sentences.chinese: 宗教改革期间，基督教对婚姻的管理被打破。

sentences.english: The Reformation comes along and things change.
sentences.chinese: 后来宗教改革发生，变化出现了。

sentences.english: Whon positive influence does the reform exert on world culture?
sentences.chinese: 宗教改革对世界文明有什么影响？

sentences.english: Henry VIII was above all responsible for the religious reform of the church .
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是，亨利八世负责进行教会的宗教改革。

sentences.english: Wycliffe was one of the greatest of the Reformers.
sentences.chinese: 威克里夫在宗教改革家中是最伟大的一位。
这是在宗教改革运动之前。

sentences.english: Elizabeths religious reform was a compromise of views.
sentences.chinese: 伊莉莎白的宗教改革是各种观点的妥协。

sentences.english: And then of course along came the Reformation.
sentences.chinese: 当然随之而来的就是宗教改革了。

definition: Martin Luther (1483-1546), key figure of the Protestant Reformation
bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
pinyin: zi1 chan3 jie1 ji2 ge2 ming4

definition: the Church (as Royal Court)/the Holy See/the Vatican
